publisher.publisher-name: U.S.-Japan Women's Center, Jōsai International Center for the Promotion of Art and Science and Purdue University

title-group.article-title: The Genealogy of Japanese "Shōjo Manga" (Girls' Comics) Studies

ref.mixed-citation: Iwashita Tomoyo. "'Shōjo manga' ni kansuru hihyōgensetsu no hihanteki kentō" (A critical consideration of remarks on shōjo manga). Naratibu media kenkyūkai dai 1-kai wākushoppu hõkokusho, komikku kenkyū nofurēmu saikō no tameni: kenkyū hōhō no tayōka to kongo no tenbō (Proceedings of the first Workshop on Narrative Media. Revisiting Frameworks for Studying Comics: Methodologies and Perspectives). (2008): 11-16.

Miyamoto Hirohito. "Shōwa 50 nendai no manga hihyō, sono shigoto to basho" (The manga criticism of the Shōwa period 50s, its work and place). Ritsumeikan Studies in Language and Culture 13.1 (May 2001): 83-94.
Murakami Tomohiko. "Kaisetsu" (Commentary). In Takeuchi Osamu and Murakami Tomohiko, eds., Manga hihyō taikei (Classification of manga criticism), vol. 2. Tokyo: Heibonsha, 1989, 275-85.

Takahashi Mizuki. "Manga kenkyū ni kansuru ichi kōsatsu: shōjo manga kenkyū no shiten kara" (One perspective concerning manga research: From the point of view of shōjo manga studies). Ritsumeikan Studies in Language and Culture 13.1 (May 2001): 149-54.

Takeuchi Osamu. "Manga hihyō no genzai: atarashiki kagakushugi e no tsuna watari" (Current manga criticism: Walking the tightrope to a new academic principle). In Yonezawa Yoshihiro, ed., Manga hihyō sengen (Manga criticism manifesto). Tokyo: Aki shobō, 1987, 67-83.
Aramata Hiroshi. "'Chō-shōjo' no gūwa" (The fable of the super-girl). Gekkan Pen 10.11 (November 1977): 186-98.

Ishiko Junzō. "Shōjo ron 1 zenshō: naze 'shōjo manga' ron de wa naku shōjo ron. nanoka?" (Shōjo theory 1 prior chapter: Why shōjo and not shõjo manga theory?). Manga shugi no. 10 (September 1972): 11-20.

Manga shinhihyō taikei (Classification of new manga criticism). This publication is a manga criticism dōjinshi (self-published fanzine) edited by Meikyū (Yonezawa Yoshihiro, Aniwa Jun, and so on). Tokyo: Meikyū.
The Kashihon Manga Kenkyūkai (Loan Book Manga Research Association) and the journal Kashihon manga kenkyūshi (History of loan book manga research). http://www.kashihon- manga.com/

Kibi Yoshito. "Chapter 3: Shōjotachi no yume no yukue: shõjo manga no sekai" (The destination of girls' dreams: The world of shõjo manga). In Kashihon Manga-shi Kenkyükai, ed., Kashihon manga RETURNS. Tokyo: Popurasha, 2006, 131-74.
Matsuda Ryōichi. Yamada Eimi ai no sekai: manga, renai Yoshimoto Banana (The world of Yamada Eimi love: Manga, love, romance, Yoshimoto Banana). Tokyo: Tokyo shoseki, 1999.

Nakajima Azusa. "Manga ha bungaku ni nani o motarashitaka: manga hyogenron josetsu" (What did manga bring to literature? Introduction to manga representation theory). Waseda bungaku 8, vol. 20 (January 1978): 30-37.
Takahashi Gen'ichiro. Bungaku ga konna ni wakatte iikashira (Is it okay to understand literature this much?). Tokyo: Fukutake shoten, 1989.

Hashimoto Osamu. "Ōshima Yumiko: haruiro momochidori" (Ōshima Yumiko: Thousands of birds of spring colors). Kokubungaku: kaishaku to kyōzai no kenkyū (Japanese literature: Interpretations and research of educational materials) 26.6 (April 1981, supplementary issue: Gendai manga no techō [Notebook of contemporary manga]): 113-17.
Ishiko Jun. Nihon manga shi (History of Japanese manga). Tokyo: Otsuki shoten, 1979.

Iwaya Kunio. "Hagio Moto: okashi no ie nitsuite" (Hagio Moto: About the gingerbread house). Kokubungaku: kaishaku to kyōzai no kenkyū 26.6 (April 1981, supplementary issue: Gendai manga no techō [Notebook of contemporary manga]): 136-40.

Kusamori Shinichi. "Takemiya Keiko: Tera e... ni miru yurikago no imēji" (Takemiya Keiko: Images of the cradle in Terra e). Kokubungaku: kaishaku to kyõzai no kenkyū, 26.6 (April 1981, supplementary issue: Gendai manga no techõ [Notebook of contemporary manga]): 130-33.

Miyasako Chizuru. "Chapter 3: 'hi-shōjo' kara 'chō-shōjo' e: Hagio Moto o meguru kinmiraiteki shõjo ron" (From the hi-shõjo to the chō-shōjo : A near-futuristic shōjo theory on Hagio Moto). In idem, Chō-shōjo e (Toward super-/beyond-girl). Tokyo: Hokusosha, 1984, 182-265.
Nakajima Azusa. "Otona wa manga o yomanai de" (Adults, don't read manga!). Chuo koron 93.11 (November 1978): 248-57.
Soeda Yoshiya. "Shojo manga nimiru gendai joshi/seinen no ren'ai" (The romanic love of girls/ boys as seen in shōjo manga). Seinen shinri 6 (January 1978): 104-9.
Yamada Tomoko. "Manga yogo '24-nen-gumi' wa dare o sasu no ka?" (Who does the manga term "Year 24 Group" refer to?). COMIC BOX 108 (August 1998): 58-63.
Hashimoto Osamu. Hana saku otome-tachi no kinpira gobō (Kinpira gobō of the blossoming maidens). Tokyo: Kawade shobō, 1984.

Miyadai Shinji. "Chapter 1: shōjo media no komyunikēshon" (Communication in shōjo media). In Miyadai Shinji, Ishihara Hideki and Ōtsuka Akiko, eds., Sabu karuchā shinwa kaitai: shōjo, ongaku, manga, sei no 30nen to komyunikēshon no genzai (Dismantling the subculture myth: 30 years of shōjo, music, manga and sex, and current state of communication). Tokyo: Parco shuppan, 1993, 9-53.
Murakami Tomohiko. Twilight Times: dojidai no manga no tameni (Twilight times: For the manga of our times). Tokyo: Buronzusha, 1979.
Ōtsuka Eiji. Tasogaredoki ni mitsuketa mono: "Ribon" no fur oku to otomechikku no jidai. (What I found in twilight times: Ribon's free gifts and the era of otome-chikku). Tokyo: Ōta shuppan, 1991.
Aramata Hiroshi. "Sai o umu hyōgen: shojo manga" (Expressions that bring about difference: Shōjo manga). Mugendai 77 (1988): 50-55.
Takaguchi Satosumi. "Shōjo mangaka no seikatsu to iken" (Lifestyle and opinions of shojo manga writers). Interview with Nakajima Azusa. Subaru 11.2 (February 1989): 180-91.
Takahashi Gen'ichirō. "Hana saku shōjo manga zasshi tachi no kageni" (In the shadows of the blooms of shōjo manga magazines). Subaru 11.2 (February 1989): 202-5.

20 seiki shõjo manga tengoku: natsukashi no mesaku kara saishin hitto made kore issatsu de kamen mora! (Twentieth-century shōjo manga heaven: From nostalgic masterpieces to recent hits, get it all in this one book!). Tokyo: Entāburein, 2001.
Bessatsu Taiyō: Kodomo no shōwashi shōjo manga no sekai (Taiyō special edition: Children's Shõwa history, world of shōjo manga I). Tokyo: Heibonsha, 1991.
Bessatsu Taiyō: Kodomo no shõwashi shōjo manga no sekai II (Taiyō special edition: Children's Shõwa history, world of shōjo manga II). Tokyo: Heibonsha, 1991.

Fujimoto Yukari. Shōjo manga damashii: genzai o utsushidasu shōjo manga kanzen gaido & intabyū shū (Spirit of shōjo manga: Complete guide to current shōjo manga and interview collection). Tokyo: Hakusensha, 2000.
Futagami Hirokazu. Shōjo manga no keiju (The genealogy of shōjo manga). Tokyo: Pengin shobo, 2005.
Yonezawa Yoshihiro. Sengo shōjo manga shi (History of postwar shojo manga). Tokyo: Shinpyōsha, 1980.

Ishita Saeko. "'Shōjo manga' no buntai to sono hōgensei" (The style and dialectal characteristic of shōjo manga). Komikku media: Yawarakai jōhō-sōchi toshiteno manga (Comic media: Manga as information device). Tokyo: NTT shuppan, 1992, 54-89.
Natsume Fusanosuke. Tezuka Osamu no bōken: sengo manga no kamigami (Adventures of Tezuka Osamu: Gods of postwar manga). Tokyo: Chikuma shobō, 1995.
---. Manga wa naze omoshiroi noka: sono hyōgen to bunpō (Why is manga interesting? Its expressions and grammar). Tokyo: NHK shuppan, 1997.
Ōtsuka Eiji. Sengo manga no hyōgen kūkan: kigō teki shintai no jubaku (Postwar shōjo manga's expression space: The curse of the symbolic body). Kyoto: Hōzōkan, 1994.
Yomota Inuhiko. Manga genron (Manga theory). Tokyo: Chikuma shobo, 1994.
Yoshimoto Takaaki. Masu imëji-ron (Mass image theory). Tokyo: Fukutake shoten, 1984.
Ishiko Jun. "Shojo manga ron: sono okina me ni yadoru sekai wa nani ka." (Shōjo manga theory: What world exists in those big eyes?) Seinen shinri (Adolescent mentality) 19 (March 1980): 83-89.

Murakami Tomohiko. "Manga jōkyō no naka no seinen zō: dokusha ron no kokoromi" (Images of young men in manga situations: An experiment in a reader-based theory). Seinen shinri (Adolescent mentality) 19 (March 1980): 59-67.

Nishimura Noriaki. "Shōjo manga 'Tenshi kinryō ku' to shishunki joshi no shinri rinshō: tōgō shicchōshōsha no numinōsu taiken no imi nitsuite no ichi kōsatsu" (A clinical look at adolescent girls and the shõjo manga "Angel Sanctuary": One consideration of the meaning of the schizophrenic experience). Shinri rinshō gaku kenkyū (Journal of Japanese clinical psychology) 22.2 (June 2004): 105-16.

Anraku Iku. "Tsukurareru onna no imōji: shōjo manga zasshi to josei zasshi o bunseki shite" (The image of a constructed woman: Analyzing shōjo manga magazines and women's magazines). Agora 25 (December 1981): 116-20.

Arikawa Yū, "Jinsei shōjo manga da!" (Life is shōjo mangal). In Kamewada Takeshi, Iijima Kōichirō and Arikawa Yū, eds., Manga wa sekai sandantobi (Manga as the hop, skip, and jump to the world). Tokyo: Hon no zasshisha, 1980, 37-86.
Ozawa Ryoko. "'Enga' to shite no shōjo manga" (Shōjo manga as a "supporting picture"). Asahi journal 19.25 (17 June 1977): 84-87.

Akagi Kanko. "Aijōbusoku no kodomotachi: shōjo manga nimiru gendai no byōri to sono jittai" (Children with insufficient love: Modern pathologies in shōjo manga and the reality). Komikku media: Yawarakai jōhō-sōchi toshiteno manga. Tokyo: NTT shuppan, 1992, 90-117.
Aono Atsuko. "Shōnen shōjo manga niokeru seiyakuwari sutereotaipu" (Gender role stereotypes in shõnen and shōjo manga). Matsuyama daigaku ronshū 1.2 (June 1989): 115-37.

Fujimoto Yukari. Watashi no ibasho wa doko ni aru no?: shōjo manga ga utsusu kokoro no katachi (Where do I belong? The inner thoughts of the girl as reflected in girls' comics). Tokyo: Gakuyō shobō, 1998.

Nimiya Kazuko. Adaruto-chirudoren to shōjo manga: hitonami ni yattekoreta onnanokotachi e. (Adult-children and shōjo manga: For the girls who have done things the usual way). Tokyo: Kosaidō shuppan, 1997.
---. Shojo manga no ai no yukue (The destination of the love of shojo manga). Yokohama: Kõei, 1994.

Sekii Mitsuo. "Shōjo manga: ai to sei no shinwa" (Shōjo manga: The myth of love and sex), Kokubungaku: kaishaku to kyõzai no kenkyü 26.6 (April 1981, supplementary issue: Gendai manga no techō [Notebook of contemporary manga]): 80-85.
Yokomori Rika. Renai wa shojo manga de osowatta: ai ni ikite koso onna!? (Love was taught by shōjo manga: Female because we live for love?!). Tokyo: Kuresutosha, 1996.

Arai Hiroyuki. "Naze 'shōjo' 'kakumei' nanoka: Shōjo kakumei Utena ron" (Why shōjo "revolution"? On Revolutionary Girl Utena). In Saitō Tamaki et al., Shōjo tachi no senreki: Ribon no kishi kar a Shōjo kakumei Utena made (The battle history of girls: From "Ribbon Knight" to "Revolutionary Girl Utena"). Tokyo: Seikyüsha, 1998, 18-29.

Endo Masayuki and Yajima Tōru, eds. Bishōjo hīrō senki: "Sukeban deka" kara "Sērā mūn " made (Military history of pretty heroines: From "Delinquent Girl Detective" to "Sailor Moon"). Yokohama: Kōē, 1994.

Murase Hiromi. "Saikyō no 'Tatakau shōjo manga': 'Sukeban deka' kara 'Sērā mūn' e" (The strongest "fighting girl manga": From "Delinquent Girl Detective" to "Sailor Moon"). Kino hyōron (Kino reviewal), (October 1998, supplementary issue: Bungaku wa naze manga ni maketa ka!? [Why has literature lost to manga!?]): 89-94.

---. "Sei no güwa toshiteno 'Shōjo kakumei Utena"' ("Revolutionary Girl Utena" as a fable of sex). In Saitxō Tamaki et al., Shōjo tachi no senreki: "Ribon no kishi" kara "Shōjo kakumei Utena" made (The battle history of girls: From "Ribbon Knight" to "Revolutionary Girl Utena"). Tokyo: Seikyūsha, 1998, 51-62.

Nimiya Kazuko. "Shōjo kakumei Utena wa tsuki gumi dearu" (Revolutionary girl Utena is in the moon troupe). In Saitō Tamaki et al., Shōjo tachi no senreki: "Ribon no kishi" kara "Shōjo kakumei Utena" made (The battle history of girls: From "Ribbon Knight" to "Revolutionary Girl Utena"). Tokyo: Seikyūsha, 1998, 30-38.

Orihara Jin. "Shōjo ga tatakau: bosei karano kaihō" (Girls fight: The release from motherhood). In Saitō Tamaki et al., Shōjo tachi no senreki: "Ribon no kishi" kara "Shōjo kakumei Utena" made (The battle history of girls: From "Ribbon Knight" to "Revolutionary Girl Utena"). Tokyo: Seikyūsha, 1998, 39-50.
Oshiyama Michiko. Shōjo manga jendã hyōshōron: "dansō no shōjo,y no zōkei to aidentitī. (Shōjo manga gender symbols: The molding and identity of "girls who dress up as boys"). Tokyo: Sairyūsha, 2007.

---. "'Ribon no kishi' ni okeru 'shojō manga' no katachi: Matsushita Ichio sakuhin tono hikaku" (The shape of shõjo manga in "Princess Knight": Comparing the work of Matsuhita Ichio). Manga kenkyü (Manga studies) 13 (2008): 44-55.
Saitō Tamaki et al. Shōjo tachi no senreki: "Ribon no kishi" kara "Shōjo kakumei Utena" made (The battle history of girls: From "Ribbon Knight" to "Revolutionary Girl Utena"). Tokyo: Seikyūsha, 1998.

Aoyama, Tomoko. "Eureka Discovers Culture Girls, Fujoshi, and BL: Essay Review of Three Issues of the Japanese Literary magazine, Yuriika (Eureka)." Intersections: Gender and Sexuality in Asia and the Pacific Issue 20 (April 2009), http://intersections.anu.edu. au/issue20/aoyama.htm

Arimitsu Mamiko, Kotani Mari, and Hikawa Reiko. "Tettei tōgi kyōraku suru shōjotachi: shōjo bunka no genzaikei: dōjinshi, komikku māketto, yaoi" (The complete debate on hedonistic girls: The current shape of girls' culture: Dōjinshi, Comiket, yaoi). Imāgo 6.4 (April 1995, special edition: Shōjo manga): 136-59.

Fujimoto Junko. "Onna ga otokoxotoko o aisuru toki: yaoi-teki yokubō ron/shiron" (When women love men with men: Theorizing/considering yaoi desire). Yuriika 39.17 (June 2007, supplementary issue: Fujoshi manga taikei [Fujoshi manga compendium]): 63-68.
Hayami To. "Hitodenashi no gēmu" (Miscreant's game). Yuriika 37.12 (November 2005, Bunka-kei joshi katarogu [Cultured girls' catalogue]): 172-77.
Hirashima Natsuko. "Yaoi shojo no seishun: yaoi manga o egaku shinri" (The youth of yaoi girls: The mentality of drawing yaoi). Imago 6.4 (April 1995, special edition: Shōjo manga): 128-35.
Ishida Hitoshi. "Gei ni kyokan suru josei tachi" (Women who empathize with gay men). Yuriika 39.7 (June 2007, supplementary issue: Fujoshi manga taikei [Fujoshi manga compendium]): 7-55.

---. "'Hottoite kudasai' toiu hyōmei o megutte: yaoi/BL no jiritsusei to hyõshõ no ōdatsu" (Confronting the exclamation "Please leave me alone": Misappropriating yaoi/BL symbols). Yuriika 39.16 (December 2007, supplementary issue: BL sutadlzu [Boys' Love studies]): 114-23.
Ishida Minori. Hisoyakana kyōiku: "yaoi, bōizu rabu " zenshi (Silent education: Prehistory of yaoi/BL). Kyoto: Rakuhoku shuppan, 2008.

Kakinuma Eiko. "'Ai' o tsukuridasu shōjo mangaka tachi: waga hen aiteki shōnen'ai manga ron" (The shōjo manga writers who manufacture "love": My loving theory of shōnen'ai manga). Imago 6.4 (April 1995, special edition: Shōjo manga): 170-78.
Kaneda Junko. "Yaoi ron, ashita no tameni sono 2" (Yaoi theories: Two for tomorrow). Yuriika 39.16 (December 2007, supplementary issue: BL sutadlzu [Boys' Love studies]): 48-54.
Kanemaki Tomoko. "Joshi ota 30nen senso" (The girl geeks' 30-year war). Yuriika 37.12 (November 2005, Bunka-kei joshi katarogu): 114-53.

KuriharaTomoyo. "Gairon2 dōjinshi o meguru kōsatsu" (Introduction 2: Observations on dōjinshi). In Kurihara Chiyo and Kakinuma Eiko, eds., Tanbi shōsetsu / gei bungaku bukku gaido (Aesthetic novels/gay literature book guide). Tokyo: Byakuya shobō, 1993, 336-38.

Misaki Naoto. "2007nen no josei kei parodi dōjinshi no dōkō" (Movements in female lines of parody dōjinshi in 2007). Yuriika 39.16 (December 2007, supplementary issue: BL sutadlzu [Boys' Love studies]): 176-79.

Miura Shion and Kaneda Junko. "'Semexuke' no mekurumeku sekai: dansei shintai no miryoku wo motomete" (The dazzling world of the 'seme and uke': Seeking the appeal of the male body). Yuriika 39.17 (June 2007, supplementary issue: Fujoshi manga taikei [Fujoshi manga compendium]): 47-55.

Mizoguchi Akiko. "Homofobikku na homo, ai yue no reipu, soshite kuiana rezubian: saikin no yaoi tekisuto o bunseki suru" (Homophobic homos, rape for love, and queer lesbians: Analyzing recent yaoi texts). Queer Japan 2 (April 2000): 193-211.

---. "Mōsōryoku no potensharu: rezubian feminisuto janru toshite no yaoi" (The potential of the power of delusion: Yaoi as a lesbian feminist genre). Yuriika 39.7 (June 2007, supplementary issue: Fujoshi manga taikei [Fujoshi manga compendium]): 56-62.
Mori Naoko. "Hādo na BL: sono kanōsei" (Hard BL: Its potential). Yuriika 39.17 (June 2007, supplementary issue: Fujoshi manga taikei [Fujoshi manga compendium]): 77-83.
Morikawa Kaichirō. "Suji de miru fujoshi" (A look at fujoshi through numbers). Yuriika 39.16 (December 2007, supplementary issue: BL sutadlzu [Boys' Love studies]): 124-35.

Nagakubo Yōko. "Josei tachi no 'kusatta yume' = 'yaoi shōsetsu': 'yaoi shōsetsu' no miryoku to sono mondaisei" (Girls' "rotten dreams" = "yaoi novels": The appeal of "yaoi novels," and its problems). Yuriika 39.17 (June 2007, supplementary issue: Fujoshi manga taikei [Fujoshi manga compendium]): 142-47.
Nakajima Azusa. Bishōnen-gaku nyūmon (Introduction to the study of beautiful boys). Tokyo: Shinshokan, 1984.
---. Komyunikēshon fuzen shōkōgun (Communication deficiency disorder). Tokyo: Chikuma shobō, 1991.
